poem:
Title: "In the Wake of Spiraling Sands"

Fingers trace the Sinai's border,
where talks and promises disband.
A spiral staircase of diplomacy,
in Jerusalem's shifting sand.

A measured beat of war-drums,
on tables where decisions stand,
Quieted by the tongue, the Phoenix,
in the shadow of the Promised Land.

A dance of idle discourse, 
over troubled holy strands.
Yet, desert winds will whisper,
peace is an unheld hand.
